episodeTitle: Scent of Danger! The Seventh Member is Nico Robin!
episodeTitleJapanese: 危険な香り！七人目はニコ・ロビン！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kiken na Kaori! Shichininme wa Niko Robin!
description: Following their escape from the Marines, Nico Robin appears aboard the Going Merry and convinces the Straw Hats to let her join the crew. Meanwhile, the aftermath of the Arabasta conflict is revealed, including Pell's miraculous survival.

endingSong.title: Memories
endingSong.note: Played in background during Arabasta aftermath scenes

events.title: Marines Pursue Going Merry
events.description: The Marines, led by Hina, continue their pursuit of the Going Merry. The Straw Hat ship appears to be taking damage and sinking as the Marines attack with cannon fire.
events.significance: Marks the final confrontation with the Marines as the Straw Hats attempt to escape Arabasta.

events.title: Metal Pipes Save the Day
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji trip over large metal pipes that Usopp had stored on the ship. Luffy throws them all off the ship, and they strike the Marine vessels, disabling them and allowing the Straw Hats to escape.
events.significance: Demonstrates how Usopp's tendency to collect items unexpectedly helps the crew, and shows Luffy's creative problem-solving.

events.title: Straw Hats Escape from Marines
events.description: Using the damaged Marine ships to their advantage, the Straw Hat Pirates successfully escape from Hina's Marine forces and sail away from Arabasta waters.
events.significance: Concludes the Marine pursuit arc and allows the crew to continue their journey on the Grand Line.

events.title: Hina Reports Bon Kurei's Capture
events.description: Hina explains to Smoker that they successfully sunk Bon Kurei's ship and captured his crew, though the Straw Hats managed to escape. Smoker seems pleased that the Straw Hats got away.
events.significance: Shows the aftermath of the Baroque Works agents' fates and reveals Smoker's complex feelings about the Straw Hats.

events.title: Smoker Informs Tashigi of Bounties
events.description: Smoker tells Tashigi about the bounties on Luffy and Zoro, informing her of Zoro's exploits at Whisky Peak and his victory over Daz Bonez in Arabasta. He assures her they will get their rematch another time.
events.significance: Updates Tashigi on the threat level of the Straw Hats and sets up future confrontations between Tashigi and Zoro.

quotes.text: They will get their rematch another time.
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Reassuring Tashigi about facing Zoro again

events.title: Tashigi Vows to Defeat Zoro
events.description: After hearing about Zoro's achievements, Tashigi renews her vow to become stronger and defeat Zoro in their next encounter.
events.significance: Reinforces Tashigi's rivalry with Zoro and her determination to grow as a swordswoman.

events.title: Nico Robin Appears on Going Merry
events.description: To the crew's shock, Nico Robin emerges from inside the Going Merry, revealing that she has been hiding as a stowaway on their ship.
events.significance: Marks Robin's dramatic entrance as she prepares to join the Straw Hat crew, creating tension and surprise among the members.

events.title: Nico Robin Joins the Straw Hat Pirates
events.description: Robin persuades the crew to let her join by explaining that Luffy saved her life against her wishes, and she now has nowhere else to go. She claims Luffy must take responsibility for forcing her to live. Luffy agrees without hesitation, making her the seventh member.
events.significance: One of the most pivotal moments in One Piece history - Robin officially becomes a Straw Hat crew member. This is unique as she invites herself rather than being invited.

quotes.text: You forced me to live. You have to take responsibility.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin's unique request to join the crew

events.title: Usopp Attempts to Interrogate Robin
events.description: Usopp, playing the role of 'Inspector Usopp', attempts to interrogate Robin about her intentions but ends up terrified of her mysterious demeanor and knowledge.
events.significance: Provides comic relief while establishing Robin's mysterious and somewhat intimidating presence among the crew.

events.title: Nami Accepts Robin After Being Bribed
events.description: Robin bribes Nami with jewels and gems, which immediately wins Nami over and secures her acceptance of Robin joining the crew.
events.significance: Showcases Nami's love of treasure and begins the relationship between the two main female crew members.

events.title: Sanji's Immediate Acceptance of Robin
events.description: Sanji immediately accepts Robin joining the crew because she is a woman, showing his typical behavior toward female crew members.
events.significance: Establishes the dynamic between Sanji and Robin, consistent with Sanji's character.

events.title: Zoro Remains Suspicious of Robin
events.description: Unlike the other crew members, Zoro remains wary and suspicious of Robin's intentions, though he is briefly disarmed by her cheerfulness.
events.significance: Sets up the initial tension between Zoro and Robin that will develop throughout future arcs, showing Zoro's protective nature toward the crew.

events.title: Robin's 20-Year Search Revealed
events.description: Robin reveals that she has spent 20 years searching for the Rio Poneglyph in order to uncover the true history of the world.
events.significance: First mention of Robin's life goal and the Rio Poneglyph, setting up one of the series' major plot threads about the Void Century and true history.

events.title: Arabasta Kingdom Recovery Begins
events.description: Scenes show the Arabasta Kingdom beginning its recovery process after the Baroque Works conflict, with citizens and royal guard working to rebuild.
events.significance: Provides closure to the Arabasta Arc by showing the positive aftermath of the Straw Hats' actions.

events.title: Potsun Debut
events.description: Dr. Potsun, an Arabasta doctor who runs an isolated clinic in the desert, makes his first appearance as the one who treated Pell's injuries.
events.significance: Introduces the character responsible for saving Pell's life after his heroic sacrifice.

events.title: Pell's Miraculous Survival Revealed
events.description: In an anime-exclusive scene, Pell is shown alive, having survived the massive bomb explosion. He approaches his own grave with disturbed astonishment, revealing he was treated by Dr. Potsun at a remote desert hospital.
events.significance: Provides closure to Pell's sacrifice and became a memorable moment for fans, confirming his survival despite the seemingly impossible odds.

events.title: Robin Stands in Straw Hat Lineup
events.description: For the first time, Robin is shown standing in the official Straw Hat Pirates crew lineup, marking her official position as the seventh member.
events.significance: Visual confirmation of Robin's membership and her place in the crew's hierarchy.

events.title: Final Vivi Eyecatcher
events.description: This episode features the last eyecatcher showing Vivi as part of the crew, with Robin also appearing in it for the first and only time.
events.significance: Marks the transition from the Arabasta Arc to the next adventure, symbolizing Vivi's departure and Robin's arrival.

quotes.text: You forced me to live. You have to take responsibility.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin's unique request to join the crew after Luffy saved her life

quotes.text: They will get their rematch another time.
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Reassuring Tashigi about facing Zoro again in the future

themes.description: Robin's request to join the crew is based on Luffy taking responsibility for saving her life. This explores themes of second chances and finding a new purpose.
themes.symbolism: Robin's emergence from the shadows of the ship represents her stepping into the light after years of running and hiding.

themes.description: The crew's varying reactions to Robin joining highlight different approaches to trust - from Sanji's immediate acceptance to Zoro's warranted suspicion.
themes.symbolism: The crew's acceptance of Robin despite her past allegiance to their enemy shows the Straw Hats' capacity for forgiveness.

themes.description: Both Robin's survival after wanting to die and Pell's miraculous survival from the explosion emphasize the theme of perseverance against impossible odds.
themes.symbolism: Pell standing at his own grave symbolizes rebirth and the triumph of will over fate.

themes.description: The episode marks the end of the Arabasta Arc while simultaneously beginning a new chapter with Robin's addition to the crew.
themes.symbolism: The transition from Vivi's eyecatcher to Robin's presence represents the passage from one adventure to the next.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin transitions from antagonist to protagonist, revealing her vulnerability and desire for a place to belong. Her 20-year search for truth is first mentioned.
keyActions: Emerges from hiding on the Going Merry
Convinces the crew to let her join
Reveals her life's mission to find the Rio Poneglyph
quotes: You forced me to live. You have to take responsibility.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his characteristic acceptance of others without judgment, immediately agreeing to Robin's request without hesitation.
keyActions: Defeats Marine pursuit with metal pipes
Accepts Robin into the crew without question
Takes responsibility for saving Robin's life

characterSpotlights.development: Pell's survival is revealed, providing closure to his heroic sacrifice and showing the consequences of his near-death experience.

mangaDifferences.difference: Pell's survival and recovery scenes with Dr. Potsun are more extensively shown in the anime. The scene of Pell at his grave is anime-exclusive with more dramatic presentation.
The Marines' pursuit and the metal pipe escape sequence is extended in the anime with more action sequences.
Extended scenes showing the Arabasta Kingdom's recovery and various citizens' reactions to peace returning.

trivia.fact: This is the last episode of the Arabasta Arc, which is one of the longest and most beloved arcs in One Piece.
This episode marks the first and only appearance of Robin in Vivi's eyecatcher lineup, symbolizing the transition between arcs.
Robin is unique among Straw Hat crew members as she invited herself to join rather than being invited by Luffy.

sources.title: What episode does Robin join the crew?

trivia.fact: The original One Piece ending theme 'Memories' by Maki Otsuki is played in the background during scenes showing the aftermath in Arabasta, creating a nostalgic callback to the series' beginning.
Yuriko Yamaguchi, Robin's Japanese voice actress, is also famous for voicing Ritsuko Akagi in Neon Genesis Evangelion and Nurse Joy in Pokémon.
The episode aired on October 27, 2002 in Japan, approximately 3 years after the anime's debut.

Pell's survival from the bomb explosion became controversial among fans, with many debating the realism of surviving such a blast, though it aligned with One Piece's general tone of avoiding major character deaths.
